## Second Punic War: A Simplified Summary

The Second Punic War (218-201 BC) was a big fight between Carthage and Rome for control of the western Mediterranean. Carthage, led by the famous general Hannibal, won early battles in Italy, even crossing the Alps from Spain. But Rome fought back, winning battles in Spain and finally defeating Hannibal in Africa.

The war lasted 17 years and was really destructive for both sides. Rome ended up taking control of Carthage's territories and made them pay a large fine. Carthage was never the same again, and later Rome destroyed it completely in the Third Punic War.
